title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

Two points for explaining that the local economy is dependent upon a large supply of immigrant labor for certain sectors of the economy or certain types of government institutions.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that discrimination may be a cultural push factor, without explicitly connecting to the rural to urban migration process.

Two points for describing a cultural push factor and explaining why this push factor would motivate a male migrant from a rural area to move to an urban area in a very distant location.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that there will be slow long-term growth, without explaining why this is likely.

Two points for explaining that there will be slow long-term growth due to migrants returning to their home countries or because the bulk of the population is male.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that migrants will introduce new culture traits or ideas, without explaining how this will occur.

Two points for explaining that immigrants will bring and introduce new cultural traits and ideas that will impact the local culture and/or increase the diversity of local culture.
